programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: China Open
programme.desc: The definitive guide to the markets in Hong Kong and on the mainland; David Ingles and Yvonne Man bring the latest news and analysis to get ready for the trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Asia
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets" banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This Asian-focused version is hosted by Shery Ahn, David Ingles, Haidi Lun, Rishaad Salamat and Angie Lau. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make investment decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Middle East
programme.desc: A focus on global macro issues with a Middle Eastern context.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe" joins the network's morning lineup to deliver viewers information about business and financial news from the region. Manus Cranny and Anna Edwards host the show from London, joined by business professionals and journalists who offer their thoughts on the day's industry happenings. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Europe
programme.desc: Anchored by Anna Edwards and Mark Cudmore, "Bloomberg Markets: Europe" is a fast-paced hour of news and analysis, building towards the start of the cash trade across the continent.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Open
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe open when most Americans are sleeping. Bloomberg covers the start of the European trading day with this show -- which airs in the early morning hours in the Eastern time zone -- as part of the network's programming block dedicated to covering financial activity overseas. The show, broadcast from London, features discussions of the stories that are expected to impact the European markets that day and, subsequently, other markets around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance: Early Edition
programme.desc: Bringing insight on global markets and the top business stories of the day from New York and London.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance: Early Edition
programme.desc: Bringing insight on global markets and the top business stories of the day from New York and London.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Live from London and New York, with insight on global markets and top business stories of the day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: The Open
programme.desc: Jonathan Ferro takes viewers through the market-moving events from around the world during the most important hour of the trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Americas
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the "Bloomberg Markets" banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This American-focused version reports on the latest business news and features interviews with political and business leaders to help investors make investment decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Close
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe close when the American markets are still in full swing. Bloomberg covers the end of the European trading day with this half-hour show -- which airs in the morning U.S. time -- during the network's "Bloomberg Markets" daytime programming block. The show is hosted by two anchors on separate continents -- Betty Liu in Bloomberg's New York studio and Mark Barton in London -- who discuss the stories that impacted the European markets that day. The show also features sound bites from some of the day's biggest news.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bloomberg Crypto
programme.desc: The latest news, analysis and interviews covering the people, transactions, and technology shaping the world of decentralized finance.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: The most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: The Close
programme.desc: Romaine Bostick breaks down top stories and trading action leading into the close.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power
programme.desc: Focusing on the intersection of politics and global business.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia
programme.desc: Bloomberg continues the expansion of its "Daybreak" franchise with this version that includes reporting from New York and Sydney, Australia. "Daybreak: Australia" delivers news from the Australian market as well as developments from around the world that matter to decision-makers in the finance industry. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the U.S. the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, "Bloomberg Daybreak Asia" features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This installment of "Daybreak" joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations
programme.desc: Philanthropist and financier David Rubenstein talks with the most influential minds in business.

programme.title: The Business of Sports
programme.desc: In his 30th season at the helm of the National Hockey League, Gary Bettman details his plan to lead the league to new heights and secure hockey's place as a top US Sport forever.

programme.title: Getting Warmer with Kal Penn
programme.desc: Kal Penn explores how a community reliant on fossil fuels is being coaxed to embrace renewables and explore climate activism as a strategy.

programme.title: Crypto IRL
programme.desc: Every week, hosts Tim Stenovic and Katie Greifeld will make sense of the crypto world. Drawing knowledge and expertise from Bloomberg Managing Editor for crypto stacy-marie ishmael and talking to big players from the industry, they'll look at the questions those in the know are asking. Using Bloomberg's wealth of knowledge and expertise, Tim and Katie will probe proponents and critics and invite the audience to understand a rapidly changing environment. From utility to energy to NFTs, from web3 to crime this series is relaxed, conversational, accessible and full of the insight you'd expect.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Asia

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Open
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe open when most Americans are sleeping. Bloomberg covers the start of the European trading day with this show -- which airs in the early morning hours in the Eastern time zone -- as part of the network's programming block dedicated to covering financial activity overseas. The show, broadcast from London, features discussions of the stories that are expected to impact the European markets that day and, subsequently, other markets around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Close
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe close when the American markets are still in full swing. Bloomberg covers the end of the European trading day with this half-hour show -- which airs in the morning U.S. time -- during the network's "Bloomberg Markets" daytime programming block. The show is hosted by two anchors on separate continents -- Betty Liu in Bloomberg's New York studio and Mark Barton in London -- who discuss the stories that impacted the European markets that day. The show also features sound bites from some of the day's biggest news.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology

The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: Hôpital New Amsterdam
programme.desc: Max et Sharpe officialisent leur relation auprès de leurs collègues; toute l'équipe va devoir mettre la main à la pâte pour maintenir à flot l'unité de soins intensifs, surchargée et en manque criant de personnel.

programme.title: L'île de l'amour
programme.desc: Des célibataires âgés de 20 à 30 ans tentent de trouver l'amour; pour rester sur l'île, les Insulaires doivent absolument former un couple; tout au long de la saison, de nouveaux participants viennent chambouler la vie dans la villa.

programme.title: TVA nouvelles
programme.desc: Pierre-Olivier Zappa présente l'actualité de dernière heure en temps réel, les nouvelles régionales, internationales et économiques, et plus encore.

programme.title: La tour
programme.desc: Gildor et Alex reçoivent la belle visite de Normand Brathwaite et Dominic Sillon.

programme.title: La joute
programme.desc: Paul Larocque et ses collaborateurs analysent et échangent sur les enjeux politiques qui préoccupent les Québécois sur les scènes provinciale, fédérale, américaine et municipale.

programme.title: Jamais de la vie
programme.desc: Ne parvenant pas à écrire la biographie d'un populaire chanteur, sa veuve s'associe à un professeur new-yorkais qui a sa propre théorie sur les circonstances de la mort de l'artiste.

programme.title: Emily Dickinson: l'histoire d'une passion
programme.desc: Dans son pensionnat de jeunes filles de bonne famille, la jeune Emily Dickinson ne cesse de se rebeller contre les discours évangéliques qui y sont professés. Son père se voit contraint de la ramener au domicile familial, pour le plus grand bonheur de sa soeur Vinnie et de son frère Austin. Passionnée de poésie, Emily écrit jour et nuit dans l'espoir d'être publiée.

programme.title: TVA nouvelles
programme.desc: Pierre-Olivier Zappa présente l'actualité de dernière heure en temps réel, les nouvelles régionales, internationales et économiques, et plus encore.

programme.title: La victoire de l'amour
programme.desc: Présentée par l'organisme catholique La Victoire de l'amour, cette émission religieuse du même nom est constituée de témoignages de personnes qui sont parvenues, grâce à leur foi, à surmonter de lourdes épreuves. Les invités font preuve de courage et sont une source d'inspiration.

programme.title: Le Québec matin
programme.desc: On suit l'actualité du jour avec Jean-François Guérin, Audrey Gagnon et ses collaborateurs dans une ambiance de convivialité.

programme.title: Salut bonjour
programme.desc: Actualité, revue de presse, météo, circulation, actualités culturelles et sportives sont abordées avec dynamisme et enthousiasme chaque matin. Différents collaborateurs viennent partager leurs passions: cuisine, santé, famille, mode, etc.

programme.title: Marie-Claude

programme.title: Mario Dumont

programme.title: La soeur de la mariée
programme.desc: Six mois après leur rencontre, Stéphanie accepte la demande en mariage de Ben et souhaite organiser la cérémonie un an plus tard, dans la maison de vacances familiale de Palm Springs. Venue pour annoncer ses fiançailles, Stéphanie apprend alors que sa soeur Tracy va également s'y marier dans trois semaines. Les soeurs ignorent encore que leurs parents ont mis en vente la demeure.

programme.title: Les aventures de Tom & Jerry
programme.desc: Toujours en train de comploter l'un contre l'autre, Tom et Jerry sont à la hauteur de leurs ébats habituels. Le chat et la souris font des farces, des blagues et partent en escapades tout autour du globe.

programme.title: Les feux de l'amour
programme.desc: Victor fait des vagues chez Newman-Jabot; Adam défend Chelsea.

programme.title: Top modèles
programme.desc: Li incite Finn à se battre pour sa vie et à revenir vers Steffy et Hayes; par ailleurs, Steffy craque en disant au revoir à Liam.

programme.title: La tour
programme.desc: Gildor et Hélène reçoivent la visite rare de Claudine Mercier.

C'est le chaos à Los Angeles; un célèbre auteur de romans policiers est décédé, laissant derrière lui un trésor d'une valeur de cinq millions enfoui quelque part dans la ville; les pompiers de la 118 décident de faire équipe pour le trouver.

programme.title: À l'aventure
programme.desc: Une famille dans la tourmente est prise par surprise dans une aventure originale où un excentrique garçon américain de huit ans, Wes, a une révélation existentielle. Il est persuadé qu'il est en fait un berger de chèvre.

programme.title: Boomerang
programme.desc: Presque 30 ans se sont écoulés depuis le décès de sa mère par noyade. C'est seulement à la suite de sa séparation qu'Antoine constate à quel point, malgré les années, cette perte l'a affligé. Le doute et le mystère ayant toujours plané sur les circonstances de la tragique noyade, Antoine demande à sa soeur Agathe de retourner sur les lieux de la tragédie. Dès leur arrivée, la fratrie découvre des éléments inquiétants grâce aux révélations d'une ancienne domestique.

Jaloux du succès de son fils, qui est devenu la source de revenus de la famille, il soumet son fils à ses insultes, sa cruauté et sa violence. On suit leur relation conflictuelle sur plus de 10 ans.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Toronto Maple Leafs vs. Tampa Bay Lightning
programme.desc: NHL Hockey

programme.title: Edmonton Oilers vs. Colorado Avalanche
programme.desc: NHL Hockey

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker
programme.desc: When it's discovered that the evil Emperor Palpatine did not die at the hands of Darth Vader, the rebels must race against the clock to find out his whereabouts. programme.title: Con Air
programme.desc: Just-paroled army ranger Cameron Poe (Nicolas Cage) is headed back to his wife (Monica Potter), but must fly home aboard a prison transport flight dubbed "Jailbird" with some of the worst criminals living. Along with Diamond Dog (Ving Rhames) and Baby-O (Mykelti Williamson), genius serial killer Cyrus "The Virus" Grissom (John Malkovich) unleashes a violent escape plot in mid-flight. Secretly working with U.S. Marshall Vince Larkin (John Cusack), Poe tries to foil Grissom's plan.

programme.desc: Alcoholic and world-weary, U.S. Air Marshal Bill Marks (Liam Neeson) lost his passion for his work long ago. programme.title: Godzilla vs. Kong
programme.desc: Kong and his protectors undertake a perilous journey to find his true home. Along for the ride is Jia, an orphaned girl who has a unique and powerful bond with the mighty beast. However, they soon find themselves in the path of an enraged Godzilla as he cuts a swath of destruction across the globe. The initial confrontation between the two titans -- instigated by unseen forces -- is only the beginning of the mystery that lies deep within the core of the planet.

programme.title: Pacific Rim
programme.desc: Long ago, legions of monstrous creatures called Kaiju arose from the sea, bringing with them all-consuming war. To fight the Kaiju, mankind developed giant robots called Jaegers, designed to be piloted by two humans locked together in a neural bridge. However, even the Jaegers are not enough to defeat the Kaiju, and humanity is on the verge of defeat. Mankind's last hope now lies with a washed-up ex-pilot (Charlie Hunnam), an untested trainee (Rinko Kikuchi) and an old, obsolete Jaeger.

programme.title: Ready Player One
programme.desc: In 2045, the planet is on the brink of chaos and collapse, but people find salvation in the OASIS, an expansive virtual reality universe created by James Halliday. When Halliday dies, he promises his immense fortune to the first person to discover a digital Easter egg that's hidden somewhere in the OASIS. When young Wade Watts joins the contest, he finds himself becoming an unlikely hero in a reality-bending treasure hunt through a fantastical world of mystery, discovery and danger.

programme.title: Tenet
programme.desc: A secret agent embarks on a dangerous, time-bending mission to prevent the start of World War III.

programme.title: The Hateful Eight
programme.desc: While racing toward the town of Red Rock in post-Civil War Wyoming, bounty hunter John "The Hangman" Ruth (Kurt Russell) and his fugitive prisoner (Jennifer Jason Leigh) encounter another bounty hunter (Samuel L. Jackson) and a man who claims to be a sheriff. Hoping to find shelter from a blizzard, the group travels to a stagecoach stopover located on a mountain pass. Greeted there by four strangers, the eight travelers soon learn that they may not make it to their destination after all.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe protects an abandoned baby boy from a vengeful spirit that has methodically killed all of the men in the child's family.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Prue and Phoebe break a code of conduct to cure Piper when she is hospitalized with a deadly disease, but the illness is spread to other patients.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe attempts to reverse the spell that turned animals into good-looking dates for her study group, creating a virtual zoo at the club.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe travels to 1924 and confronts an immortal warlock (Tyler Christopher) who forced her to destroy Prue and Piper in a past life.

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Criminal mastermind Bane (Antonio Sabato Jr.) kidnaps Prue and makes her protect him from a powerful demon.

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: In 2035, highly intelligent robots fill public service positions throughout the world, operating under three rules to keep humans safe. Despite his dark history with robotics, Detective Del Spooner (Will Smith) investigates the alleged suicide of U.S. Robotics founder Alfred Lanning (James Cromwell) and believes that a human-like robot (Alan Tudyk) murdered him. With the help of a robot expert (Bridget Moynahan), Spooner discovers a conspiracy that may enslave the human race.

programme.title: Black Panther
programme.desc: After the death of his father, T'Challa returns home to the African nation of Wakanda to take his rightful place as king. When a powerful enemy suddenly reappears, T'Challa's mettle as king -- and as Black Panther -- gets tested when he's drawn into a conflict that puts the fate of Wakanda and the entire world at risk. Faced with treachery and danger, the young king must rally his allies and release the full power of Black Panther to defeat his foes and secure the safety of his people.

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: In 2035, highly intelligent robots fill public service positions throughout the world, operating under three rules to keep humans safe. Despite his dark history with robotics, Detective Del Spooner (Will Smith) investigates the alleged suicide of U.S. Robotics founder Alfred Lanning (James Cromwell) and believes that a human-like robot (Alan Tudyk) murdered him. With the help of a robot expert (Bridget Moynahan), Spooner discovers a conspiracy that may enslave the human race.

programme.title: Black Panther
programme.desc: After the death of his father, T'Challa returns home to the African nation of Wakanda to take his rightful place as king. When a powerful enemy suddenly reappears, T'Challa's mettle as king -- and as Black Panther -- gets tested when he's drawn into a conflict that puts the fate of Wakanda and the entire world at risk. Faced with treachery and danger, the young king must rally his allies and release the full power of Black Panther to defeat his foes and secure the safety of his people.
